alert.note: Alert for Shackelford; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 11:57PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Shackelford and southern Throckmorton Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1155 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over The Intersection Of Us-183 And Us- 283, or 8 miles south of Throckmorton, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Throckmorton, Woodson, Fort Griffin, The Intersection Of Us- 183 And Us-283, Lusk, The Intersection Of Us- 380 And Highway 222 and The Intersection Of Us- 283 And Ranch Road 209. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
